channel.title: Random items weild in weapon?
channel.description:
Hello everyone, sorry for posting so much.. I'm just trying to get this server working. Well, the problem is that random items such as dragon boots, void, barrows, ect. will weild in the weapon slot. I know I can put it in item.java to make it weild right but I can't do this for every single item.. Isn't there some way to load all the items into the right slots? Here is a pic..
[IMG]http://i1096.photobucket.com/albums/g323/thebestofall11/handweild.png[/img] It does the same thing for dboots, void, and tons of other items.. any way to fix?

item.title: Random items weild in weapon?
item.dc:creator: @Vexillum Vexillum
item.description:
@Vexillum wrote:

[quote=“ExtremeX-Scape™, post:17, topic:404490”][quote author=Vexillum link=topic=501524.msg3669876#msg3669876 date=1310843366]

I just told you where to put it.

I know but how come in the other sources it isn’t in item.java or itemassistant.java but it still weilds in correct spot?
[/quote]
I don’t know?
I’ve never really messed with arranging item’s, I just know how it’s done.[/quote]

Alright then, thanks for the help.

Read full topic

item.title: Random items weild in weapon?
item.dc:creator: @Vexillum Vexillum
item.description:
@Vexillum wrote:

[quote=“ExtremeX-Scape™, post:12, topic:404490”][quote author=Vexillum link=topic=501524.msg3669372#msg3669372 date=1310806447]

Then just add them; or try to leech it off another server XD (btw enjoy the rep i gave u)

Okay, thanks for trying to help

Btw… I did look at 3 other servers item.java and none of them had the id 10551 (fighter torso) in them. So it must load them in the right slots some other way…
[/quote]
ItemAssistant,

public boolean wearItem

in that boolean, find switch (wearID)
under it add,

case ITEM_ID:
c.targetSlot = SLOT;
break;

Also to figure out what slot is which I made this little guide,

/** * cape = targetSlot = 1; * hat = targetSlot = 0; * amulet = targetSlot = 2; * arrows = targetSlot = 13; * body = targetSlot = 4; * shield = targetSlot = 5; * legs = targetSlot = 7; * gloves = targetSlot = 9; * boots = targetSlot = 10; * ring = targetSlot = 12; */ [/quote]

I looked in 3 diff servers in itemassistant and the only thing I saw the fighter torso for was to set the defence requirement to 40… And in those 3 the fighter torso was just fine in the body slot. I said before there are probably alot of items like this… Isn’t there another way to load it…? I mean in all the sources they didn’t put EVERY single item in itemassistant.java to wield it in a certain slot.

Read full topic

item.title: Random items weild in weapon?
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“Vexillum, post:11, topic:404490”][quote author=Meeper98 link=topic=501524.msg3669368#msg3669368 date=1310806328]
Then just add them; or try to leech it off another server XD (btw enjoy the rep i gave u)
[/quote]

Okay, thanks for trying to help

Btw… I did look at 3 other servers item.java and none of them had the id 10551 (fighter torso) in them. So it must load them in the right slots some other way…[/quote]
ItemAssistant,

public boolean wearItem

in that boolean, find switch (wearID)
under it add,

case ITEM_ID:
c.targetSlot = SLOT;
break;

Also to figure out what slot is which I made this little guide,

				/**
				* cape = targetSlot = 1;
				* hat = targetSlot = 0;
				* amulet = targetSlot = 2;
				* arrows = targetSlot = 13;
				* body = targetSlot = 4;
				* shield = targetSlot = 5;
				* legs = targetSlot = 7;
				* gloves = targetSlot = 9;
				* boots = targetSlot = 10;	
				* ring = targetSlot = 12;
				*/

Read full topic

item.title: Random items weild in weapon?
item.dc:creator: @Vexillum Vexillum
item.description:
@Vexillum wrote:

Meeper98:

Try searching the fighter torso id through out the item.java if its not in there, add it to the platebody thing like i said; and if it still doesnt work; i have no idea.

I know that if I add it to the platebody it will work but the thing is… there are probably 100 other items like this… Only a few I have tried don’t work they include rune defender, barrows, dboots, torso, ect… there are alot more items than the torso that don’t weild in the correct slot.

Read full topic

I looked at 3 different sources and the torso id is added no where in item.java so it must load all those items in the correct slots some other way…

It doesn’t only do this for fighter torso… it does this for alot of other items also…
